sen.j: 太田 重兵衛（おおた じゅうべえ、文化 (元号)14年（1817年） - 明治2年（1869年））は、近江国膳所（大津市）出身の茶司、元膳所藩士。
sen.e: Jubei OTA (1817 - 1869) was 茶司 and a former feudal retainers of Zeze Domain from Zeze, Omi Province (Otsu City).

sen.j: 殖産興業を目指していた彼は、武士を捨て山城国宇治市へ行き、製茶法を収得する。
sen.e: Jubei, who aimed at encouragement of new industry, was retired from samurai and went to Uji City, Yamashiro no Kuni to master method of tea manufacture.

sen.j: 膳所に戻って茶園を開き、藩より御茶司に任命される。
sen.e: He went back to Zeze to open the tea garden and was appointed as 御茶司 by Zeze Domain.

sen.j: マシュー・ペリー来航の際、重兵衛の茶「無銘」が賞され我が国初の対米輸出品となる。
sen.e: At the time of the arrival of Commodore Matthew Perry, Jubei's tea "Mumei" was praised and it became the Japan's first export goods toward the United States.

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）藩の命を受け、それまで荒地であった園山の地十三町歩を開墾して園山茶園を拓く。
sen.e: In 1855, by the domain's command, he cultivated 13 chobu (hectare) of the land of Sonoyama which used to be waste land, and opened Sonoyama tea garden.

sen.e: Although Jubei established tea party places in the domain and took part in agricultural administration and worked hard for it, he was caught up in trouble of water and killed by farmers.
